e5: An ethical reporting policy should provide accurate, transparent, and timely financial information to all stakeholders. The policy must avoid misleading investors and compel management to adhere to standards of honesty and integrity in their dealings with the market. In this case, considerations for retail investors, fairness, and transparency weigh heavily in favor of a change to the unbiased reporting policy, minimizing the potential risks from legal liability and ensuring adherence to ethical principles.
